meanings.definition: A shot in basketball made by a player jumping into the air and releasing the ball at the highest point of the jump.
meanings.sent1: During the game, his jumpshot was accurate and helped his team score points.
meanings.sent2: She practiced her jumpshot every day to improve her shooting skills.
meanings.sent3: The coach joked that his jumpshot was so good, he could score blindfolded!
meanings.sent4: Her jumpshot was like a graceful dance, soaring through the air towards the basket.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the ball swishing through the net after his jumpshot was music to his ears.

meanings.definition: To take a jump shot in basketball.
meanings.sent1: He likes to jumpshot from the three-point line for a higher chance of scoring.
meanings.sent2: Players often jumpshot when they are closely guarded by defenders.
meanings.sent3: The young player jumpshot with such enthusiasm that he almost touched the ceiling!
meanings.sent4: She jumpshot with such precision that it seemed like the ball had a mind of its own.
meanings.sent5: The crowd cheered as he jumpshot from half-court and made an unbelievable shot.
